Iglesias fa servir la coalició amb el PSOE a les Balears contra Sánchez
Iglesias va celebrar que a les illes “s’ha respectat que la gent ha votat diferent i que s’ha acabat el bipartidisme”

02 Nov 2019, 00:04

Pablo Iglesias va triar ahir Palma per dur a terme el seu primer acte de campanya, i no va ser una decisió a l’atzar: a les Illes Balears hi ha un executiu de coalició, en el qual el Partit Socialista i Podem treballen plegats, juntament amb Més. De fet, Iglesias va fer servir el govern de Francina Armengol per atacar Pedro Sánchez, amb qui no ha arribat a cap acord per evitar la repetició electoral. Més de 1.000 persones van omplir una de les sales del Palau de Congressos.
“Estic convençut que a Armengol li agradaria governar en solitari, però és intel·ligent i sap que, si no tens majoria absoluta, has de compartir les responsabilitats”, va dir Iglesias, que va recordar que Podem ha format part de governs al País Valencià, les Canàries, l’Aragó, Navarra i la Rioja. “Per què els barons del PSOE entenen que cal arribar a acords i Pedro Sánchez pensa que ha de tenir tot el poder sense vots suficients?”, es va preguntar.
Iglesias va afirmar que a les Balears “s’ha respectat que la gent ha votat diferent i que s’ha acabat el bipartidisme” i va destacar que els representants del partit lila formen part de l’executiu “de manera responsable”. “Segur que molta gent que va votar el PSOE està contenta”, va afegir.
Va criticar també amb força “els constitucionalistes”, que “no han llegit” la carta magna i la fan servir “com a pedra contra l’adversari” i, com és habitual en ell, va fer un repàs d’alguns dels seus articles, com el 31, que diu que “el sistema fiscal ha de ser redistributiu”, o el 47, que garanteix el dret a l’habitatge.
text:
Iglesias uses the coalition with the PSOE in the Balearics against Sanchez
Iglesias celebrated that in the islands "it has been respected that people have voted different and that the bipartisan has finished"

02 Nov 2019, 00:04

Pablo Iglesias yesterday chose Palma to carry out his first campaign, and it was not a random decision: in the Balearic Islands there is a coalition executive, in which the Socialist Party and We can work together, along with More. In fact, Iglesias used the government of Francina Armengol to attack Pedro Sánchez, with whom he has not reached any agreement to avoid electoral recurrence. More than 1,000 people filled one of the rooms of the Palacio de Congresos.
"I am convinced that Armengol would like to govern alone, but he is intelligent and knows that if you do not have an absolute majority, you have to share the responsibilities," said Iglesias, who reminded that we can have been part of governments in the country Valencian, the Canary Islands, Aragon, Navarre and La Rioja. "Why Barons of the PSOE understand that agreements must be reached and Pedro Sánchez thinks that he must have all the power without enough votes?" He asked.
Iglesias affirmed that in the Balearic Islands "it has been respected that people have voted different and that the bipartisan has finished" and emphasized that the representatives of the Lilac party are part of the executive "in a responsible manner". "I'm sure many people who voted for the PSOE are happy," he added.
He also strongly criticized the "constitutionalists," who "have not read" the "magna" letter and use it "as a stone against the adversary" and, as is customary in him, made a review of some of his articles , like 31, which says that "the tax system must be redistributive," or 47, which guarantees the right to housing.
